alert.note: Alert for Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, southeastern Mingo, central Raleigh, Wyoming and southeastern Logan Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1106 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hanover, or 12 miles west of Pineville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Mabscott, Oceana, Sophia, Man, Hanover, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, R.d. Bailey Lake, Beaver, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City, Prosperity, Mallory and Amherstdale-Robinette. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 37 and 48. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
